page.title: 05HOUSING
page.content: The population of Bingham is approximately{7,000}. The people live in the main in private houses but there is also a fairly large{council {estate,}which was the first estate built in Bingham. There still exists a number of old houses and buildings around the centre of Bingham, which made up the old village, but various private estates have been built since the council estate. The{Enness estate}was built in two phases: firstly the{Church Farm estate and then the{Holme Farm estate.}The {Gough Cooper estate}was built next and this was followed by the{Vic Hallam {estate,}which has been nicknamed the 'Tree' estate because all the roads were named after trees(e.g. Ash Grove, Cedar Close, Oak Avenue, etc). The {Greenwood estate}was built 7 years ago and the{Winhill estate}is under way.
